results.title: The Consultation
results.creator_credit: Liz Crosby, Frances McGivern and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Betty (Leverne McDonnell) sees Larry (Matthew Crosby) across a bar. There is mutual interest, engagement, excitement, and of course, attraction. A stylish, erotic drama with a twist in the tale; a romance for the times we live in.

results.title: The Competitive Edge
results.brief_description: A study of Victoria’s economic strategy for growth which singles out areas of competitive strength. The nine areas selected for government support include: 1)industrial skills; 2)commercial centre; 3)research capability; 4)brown coal; 5)off shore oil; 6)agriculture; 7)location centrality; 8)national role as cultural and commercial centre; 9)tourism.

results.title: The Company of officer cadets
results.creator_credit: Phillip Mark-Law, Artransa Park Studios and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A career as an Army Officer is one which might not normally occur to a young man choosing his future profession. The busy life of young men at one of Australia’s officer-training schools where, behind the parades, formal social functions and tradition, there is difficult and demanding study to train men for battle and for times of national disaster.

results.title: The Communicators
results.brief_description: Radio communications have made tremendous advances in the 20th century and the Army keeps up with them in this important facet of military operations. Specialists and equipment of the Royal Australian Corps of Signals feature in this interesting film.

results.title: The Colour of Pomegranates; Legend of the Suram Fortress
results.creator_credit: Sergo Paradjanov and Armenfilm U S S R
results.brief_description: The Colour of Pomegranates is a stream of religious poetic and local iconography of astonishing beauty, based on the work of Armenian poet Sayat Nova. “Legend of the Suram fortress” is set in Georgia and was Paradjanov’s first film after eleven years enforced confinement. It is based on a Georgian legend and continues the tension of Paradjanov’s earlier works concerning free will and predestination. Dedicated to Georgian warriors, it is a bold metaphor for Georgia’s independence from “Mother Russia”.

results.title: The Colonies and Britain
results.creator_credit: Colonial Office and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows the part played by Britain in making her colonies, particularly those in Africa, technically and economically ready for self-government. Illustrates how the Colonial Office is taking measures in Africa to fight disease, plague and ignorance, how the valuable resources of the colonies are being surveyed and how the necessary technical equipment is being supplied to develop these resources for the benefit of the peoples of the area.

results.title: The Codling moth
results.creator_credit: J.V. Durden, Stephen Ackroyd and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: A detailed study of the life cycle of the Codling Moth: the laying and hatching of the eggs; the larva burrowing to the centre of an apple and feeding; larva leaving the infected fruit for hibernation; spinning of the cocoon; changes taking place in the pupal stage; emergence of the adult moth. A diagrammatic section summarises the main stages of the life cycle. No narration, only music.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J.V. Durden, Stephen Ackroyd and Shell Film Unit

results.title: The Coal question
results.creator_credit: Tony Chenn, Nicholas Alexander and CSIRO
results.brief_description: There are many questions raised about how coal, Australia’s major export earner, can be used most effectively and most responsibly. This film looks at the role of science in confronting these questions and describes the efforts and results of researchers in areas such as mine safety, coal to oil conversion and pollution control systems.
